1) Is it subscription, one time pay, or free to play game?

2) Is it PvE (like WoW Normal servers) or PvP (like Lineage)?

it's F2P but stuff is set regularly that might get you to want to buy it. Or you have to grind a lot to get them. > 
> 1) Is it subscription, one time pay, or free to play game?
> 2) Is it PvE (like WoW Normal servers) or PvP (like Lineage)?

It is effectively a Free to play game with the option to set up a subscription for ease of access to get ships and other stuff that you cannot get either by energy credit (main in-game currency) or as rewards for doing missions

There is very much based around the main story missions (which they are slowly revamping from when I started), but there is other stuff you can do including both pvp and pve. Also, you have a passive alternative to battling in missions to level up (you can currently level up to level 60 Fleet Admiral on the Federation side) in the form of duty officer missions (I can't remember what level you can start doing this, though I am positive that it is after you get your second ship).

The difference between PvE and PvP is that:

On PvP server / game you can be attacked by other player in normal (non-battleground) areas without your consent, in PvE games PvP is limited to agreed duels and designated battlegrounds.

So what happens in Star Track Online?

The way it is set up in STO (as we call it for short), is that the main "lobby" is set apart from both pvp and pve. HOWEVER, there you can access either by using the minimap UI and enter into either the PVE events or into PVP arena. On the main space lobby, people of different factions can mingle but are not able to attack each other outright.

> 
> The difference between PvE and PvP is that:
> On PvP server / game you can be attacked by other player in normal (non-battleground) areas without your consent, in PvE games PvP is limited to agreed duels and designated battlegrounds.
> 
> So what happens in Star Track Online?

In STO, players cannot be attacked unless they are participating in a PvP mission.

The exception is the Kerrat System, but then again, it's one tiny map that's considered broken anyway.
Yeah, I am wondering why they have not either fixed or removed that one...
no problem! I just thought that it might be an enjoyable experience for new players, especially with this current new player deal they have going on!

It is one of the better free to play games. Lots of explosions and some good improvements over the last year or so.
